intro: Acinos thymoides, commonly known as mountain thyme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, fragrant, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its aromatic properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
